result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:33 PM Defendant Clayton T. Kuehl appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Clayton T. Kuehl. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Svehlek states had NGI examination on Defendant - was not able to e-file document (too large) - would like to change plea to NGI. Schiek will file request for second opinion. Court notes change of plea. Court will set out. Court states Schiek does not have to disclose examiner at this time. Bond continued. adj. 01:38 PM
Status conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:35PM Defendant Clayton T. Kuehl appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Clayton T. Kuehl.  Attorney Michael William Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Svehlek statement to status- no resolution as of yet.  Medical records/discovery still coming in. Schiek statement - case is moving along, but needs additional time has been in contact with victim's family. 
Bail continued
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's continued

Kuehl.  Svehlek states not ready to resolve or set for trial - things are moving forward - would like to set out. Bond continued. adj.

Must comply with any and all Children's Court orders/If Defendant has an issued passport it must be released to the COC Office/No contact with mother of his children other that what is required of any court order involving their common children

3:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Clayton T. Kuehl appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Clayton T. Kuehl. Schiek states they request an adjournment - victim had a surgery this morning and trying to figure out diagnosis before proposal is submitted. Schiek states victim wanted to modify bond - to have no contact. Svehlek states bond has not been signed - victims requests has been heard and jail has taken appropriate steps. Court statement to bond. Court modifies bond conditions. adj. 03:35 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

02:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Clayton T. Kuehl appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Clayton T. Kuehl. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Svehlek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Schiek willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 02:05 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
